title: Chef/e Projet Finance & Data H/F
full_description:
Chef/fe de projet Finance & Data

Engie Green

Paris ou toute agence

Acteur principal de la transition énergétique, ENGIE Green accompagne ses clients dans le développement, la construction et l'exploitation des installations de production d'énergies vertes notamment de parcs éoliens et centrales solaires.

Nos équipes réalisent des projets sur-mesure performants et novateurs qui donnent tout son sens à la transition énergétique.

Au sein de la direction financière d'ENGIE Green, nous recherchons notre Chef de projet Finance & Data (H/F).

Rattaché au Responsable du Pôle Support et Performance Finance, vous êtes l'interlocuteur privilégié du Groupe, sur les aspects innovations financières, Data Analyse.

Vous êtes le garant de l'optimisation de la donnée et diffusez vos connaissances Data et BI auprès de la Direction Financière. En somme, vous êtes Vous êtes le référent Data & Analytics de la Finance. Aussi vous ferez partie de la communauté des experts SAP pour optimiser les process.

Vos principales missions peuvent être résumées ainsi :
Etes le référent SAP à la Finance de par votre expertise technique de cet ERP
Travaillez avec les autres départements (Partenaires Groupe et Directions Métier) pour assurer une utilisation optimale de l'ERP groupe SAP (suivi du traitement des incidents et des évolutions - participation aux comitologies)
Vous assurez du respect des règles analytiques relatives au schéma de gestion du groupe implémenté dans SAP en étant l'interlocuteur référent interne sur les demandes de création, suppression, modification d'objet analytiques, et en assurer le suivi et la maintenance.
Dans le cadre du projet du groupe GET (Global Entreprise Transformation) qui consiste à une migration SAP, vous serez amené à participer à certaines réunions/ateliers.
Apportez des solutions IT aux problématiques métier, notamment Finance, avec une recherche de l'automatisation et de l'industrialisation des outils.
Suivez les évolutions du SI Finance en relation avec les référents IT groupe et leur correct déploiement.
Formez les équipes aux nouveaux outils développés.
Contribuez à la cartographie du SI Finance.
Rédigez ou contribuez à la rédaction des procédures en lien avec le SI Finance.
Contribuez à et/ou gérez des projets structurants de l'entreprise de par vos compétences informatiques (BI...)


Ce qui nous plaira le plus chez vous :

Dans votre bagage, on aimerait trouver une formation de niveau Bac+4/5, une expérience solide (à minima 5 ans) dans le domaine SI Finance & Data Analyst.

Vous maitrisez :
La planification financière et les états financiers
Les techniques et outils d'analyse des données ainsi que des outils de data visualisation
SAP (modules CO, MM, SD, FI...)
Excel, BI ou SQL etc..

Pédagogue, orienté team spirit et doté d'un bon relationnel, vous êtes à l'aise en gestion de projets transverses.

Expérience Finance / PBI / SAP / Chef de projet

Ce qui vous plaira le plus chez nous :

Un projet d'entreprise ambitieux, orienté vers un avenir énergétique responsable.

Participer à la transition énergétique en poursuivant notre objectif de faire d'ENGIE le leader des énergies renouvelables en France.

Une entreprise ouverte à la différence, source d'enrichissement et d'épanouissement personnels dans un Groupe qui offre des opportunités de développement.

Rejoignez les équipes d'ENGIE Green!

ENGIE Green est un employeur engagé dans la diversité, l'égalité des chances et la création d'un environnement inclusif pour tous. Toutes les candidatures sont examinées en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise, des exigences du poste et des qualifications individuelles, sans aucun égard quant à l'origine, l'âge, le patronyme, l'identité, l'orientation ou la préférence sexuelle, la religion, la situation familiale, l'état de santé, le handicap, les opinions politiques, les engagements syndicats ou encore la citoyenneté. Nos différences font notre force !

ENGIE est un employeur engagé dans la diversité, l'égalité des chances et la création d'un environnement inclusif pour tous. Toutes les candidatures sont examinées en fonction des besoins de l'entreprise, des exigences du poste et des qualifications individuelles, sans aucun égard quant à l'origine, le genre, l'âge, le patronyme, l'identité, l'orientation sexuelle, la religion, la situation familiale, l'état de santé, le handicap, les opinions politiques, les engagements syndicaux ou encore la citoyenneté.

Chez ENGIE, vous aurez l'opportunité de montrer qui vous êtes réellement, avec vos compétences... et vos différences.

title: Org Data Senior Analyst
full_description:
Job Description:

People & Culture (P&C) Solution & Services (S+S) is an internal global HR shared services organisation, responsible for delivering centralised and standardised HR services for BP from a number of geographical delivery centres as appropriate for BP's footprint. S+S are the first point of contact for P&C related matters; the team are policy and process experts, dedicated to delivering the best customer experience.

The purpose of Organizational Data analyst role is to support the business in the organization process and data changes across the breadth of the Workday processes. This can come in the form of providing guidance and information to employees, managers and HR relating to this topic, administer and transaction employee and organizational cases through cases, support reorganizations by working closely with the appropriate stakeholders to project manage the changes to successful completion.

Key Accountabilities:

Good understanding of the organization and its functions and the operation as well as the internal process. Able to contextualize the subject area to the organization, its functions and processes
Work closely with Workforce Admin team within and across Regional Delivery Centre(s) to ensure overall operational objectives are met including alignment of process changes related to Organization Management, employee data related and providing support to investigate, liaise, and resolve complex issues involving multiple systems and stakeholders
Monitor and contribute towards improvement of the Organization Management processes and procedures are being followed in accordance to the Standard Operating Procedures
Handle the integration data error logs, working with either the WFA team and Solutions Support team to identify and resolve issues
Support and complete any Workday processes' mass data uploads with high attention to detail and accuracy, including transactions and handle associated tasks for employee personal and job-related data service requests
Support Workday configuration changes through testing of changes and coordination with country and global functional team
Provide support for new joiners including producing training plans and keeping on-boarding materials up to date
Coach and mentor team members regarding specific operational issues and processes, providing feedback to line manager where necessary
Act as the first point of escalation within the team, coordinate the resolution of business issues
Assist and coordinate Services projects and support Solutions projects applying process expertise and project management guidelines
Be an ambassador for change encouraging agile ways of working & improvements to day-to-day activities and Domain Expert areas

Essential Education & Experience:

Bachelor's degree is preferred or relevant experience
Minimum of 3 years of relevant previous experience

Technical Capability

Breadth and depth across the HR technical areas and able to provide professional advice and act as a coach to others in most of the areas
Prior experience in HR Shared Service / service centre in a multi-national organisation
Developing specific technical capability and experience in organisational management
A passion and interest in emerging trends in customer experience and how this can enhance business performance
Experience of working in diverse and multi-lingual environment
Analytical thinking - comfortable using analytics to identify outcomes and influence decision making, e.g. ER strategies, targeted retention, succession planning & strategic workforce shaping
Digital fluency - not only comfortable and competent using technology to enable and enhance ways of working and thinking, also comfortable in the wider digital environment and working with business transformation including people, processes and data driven actions.

Business Capability

Drives value-adding solutions and a track record of improving.
Externally orientated - actively working on developing external connections, aware of best practice and actively learns from others. Ability to analyse leading practice, market trends and benchmarking
Relationship management - Ability to build and maintain relationships with customers. Is building and applying skills in active listening and is able to communicate effectively (written and verbal).
Business acumen & customer focus- keeps up to date with internal and external context, seeks to understand the relationship between their activity and the local business drivers. Aware that HR is an enabler of the business and seeks to ensure HR solutions lead to enhanced business

Leadership & EQ Capability

Continually enhancing capability in line with HR Capability Framework with an equal balance of EQ, IQ and Drive
Group mind-set - demonstrates an understanding of the value of, and ability to develop, high quality, trust-based relationships with HR colleagues & with the wider organisation - leaders & employees
Is self-aware and actively seeks input from others on impact and effectiveness
Great teammate able to work efficiently across organisational boundaries
Applies judgement and common sense - demonstrates good understanding of client's business and is able to apply sound judgement / wise counsel
Acts with integrity; role model of BP V&Bs to others in the function and business
Cultural fluency - able to operate efficiently across cultural boundaries with sensitivity

Desirable Criteria:

Proficient knowledge of CRM systems
Proficient in using MS Office
Foundational knowledge of Reporting & Analytics
Proficient knowledge of HR system such as Workday
A continuous improvement approach; seeking simple, 'best fit' solutions to challenges.

Why join us?

At bp, we support our people to learn and grow in a diverse and challending environment. We believe that our team is strengthened by diversity. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment in which everyone is respected and treated fairly. There are many aspects of our employees' lives that are meaningful, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life! These benefits can include flexible working options, paid parental leave policy among others!

Travel Requirement
No travel is expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:
This role is not eligible for relocation

Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:
Analytical Thinking, Communication, Creativity and Innovation, Customer service delivery excellence, Data Management, Digital fluency, Discovered resource estimation and assurance, Global Perspective, Group Problem Solving, Information Security, Leading transformation, Management Reporting, Managing change, Organizational knowledge, Stakeholder Management, Workday

Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp's recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

title: Real Estate Portfolio Management & Data Specialist
full_description:
Real Estate Portfolio Management & Data Specialist

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.

This position reports to

RE Portfolio Manager

Your role and responsibilities

Job description China real estate portfolio data management & data analytics - Support for data input of facilities, resources and/or associated activities and services required by the organization including Central Real Estate Information Management System / Real Estate Project Tracker / Master Data ABB Locations / ABB TRIRIGA etc China Real estate performance measurement - Support for GMAS RE transaction, RE CAPEX spending monitor, OCC cost measurement and RE OPEX saving implementation to achieve cost-effective improvements in real estate assets and services to support operations, increase business satisfaction and ensure compliance with all policies and regulations. Workplace management - Supervise and manage the space planning and efficient allocation and administration of space utilization in occupied buildings. Support the layout of workspaces for maximum effectiveness. Consolidates dispersed locations with co-location concepts, eliminating vacancies with flexible subleases. China RE function financial management - Support to function controlling month end closing, financial reporting on time delivery with quality, cost centre budgeting, and business review presentations

Qualifications for the role

Bachelor's degree, Real Estate Portfolio Management and financial management is preferred
5+ years related working experience.
Familiar with local related Real Estate and Portfolio Management legal and regulations, policy.
Strong knowledge and experience in SAP and MS Office, power BI is a plus
Good English speaking and written skills
Good communication skills, project management skill preferred


More about us

We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Masterand (w/m/d): AI based object detection and depth estimation for precrash estimations using synthetic data generation and sensor data fusion
full_description:
Aufgaben Aufgaben Aufgaben

Sensoren der Fahrerassistenz (FAS) und des hochautomatisierten Fahrens (HAF) können Teilnehmer im Straßenverkehr detektieren. Hierzu gehören unter anderem Kraftfahrzeuge und Menschen. Die Anforderungen an das automatisierte Fahren steigen stetig an, weshalb die Erkennung von neuen Objekten notwendig sein wird. Unter anderem müssen weitere Objekte als mögliche Kollisionsgegner erkannt werden.
Insbesondere im Bereich der Bildverarbeitung bietet die künstliche Intelligenz ein großes Potential, neuartige Objekte mit KI-Modelle zuerkennen. Hierbei können Methoden von Computer Vision/ Domain Adaption/ Transfer Learning genutzt werden. Zusätzlich können synthetisch erstellte Daten genutzt werden.
Im Rahmen dieser Arbeit soll eine Bilddetektion entwickelt werden, die eine Detektion und Entfernungsschätzung von Objekten mit Hilfe von Computer Vision und Sensordatenfusion realisiert.

Methodische Vorgehensweise
Literaturrecherche zu existierenden objektspezifischen Datensätzen und Modellen
Aufbau einer Sensordatenfusion zur Objekterkennung und Entfernungsschätzung
Training und Optimierung eines ML-Modells zur Objekterkennung
Erstellung von Testfällen zur Validierung der Daten- und Modell-Methoden
Definition der Grenzen der Methode

Anforderungen Anforderungen Anforderungen

Studium der Informatik oder ähnliche MINT-Studiengänge
Schwerpunkt Machine Learning, Computer Vision
Programmierkenntnisse: Python: Pytorch/Tensorflow/Keras, Pandas, Numpy, CV2 etc.
Wünschenswert: ROS, C++
Gutes Verständnis von Kamerasensorik wünschenswert
Gute Englisch- und Deutschkenntnisse
Hohe Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Strukturierte Betrachtungsweise und die Fähigkeit, eigene Projekte voranzutreiben

Unternehmensprofil Unternehmensprofil Unternehmensprofil

"Am Anfang schaute ich mich um, konnte aber den Wagen, von dem ich träumte, nicht finden. Also beschloss ich, ihn mir selbst zu bauen."

Dieser Satz von Ferry Porsche bringt alles auf den Punkt, was Porsche ausmacht. Als Marke, als Unternehmen, als Automobilhersteller, als Arbeitgeber. Die "Idee Porsche" hat so einzigartige Sportwagen wie den Porsche 356 oder den 911 hervorgebracht. Durch die Kombination von Tradition und Innovation mit den Porsche typischen, manchmal etwas unkonventionellen Denkweisen unserer Mitarbeiter, lassen wir automobile Träume wahr werden und haben so immer das "Etwas-mehr" im Blick. Porsche ist allerdings viel mehr als "nur" ein exklusiver Sportwagenhersteller. Denn auch als Arbeitgeber hat Porsche viel zu bieten: vielfältige Einstiegs- und Karrieremöglichkeiten, Maßnahmen zur Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie sowie flexible Arbeitszeitmodelle.

Exklusive Einblicke hinter die Kulissen Exklusive Einblicke hinter die Kulissen Exklusive Einblicke hinter die Kulissen

Unabhängig von dem, was andere tun, sind wir stets bestrebt, unsere Grenzen ständig neu zu definieren und Maßstäbe zu setzen. Das können wir heute und in Zukunft aber nur mit Mitarbeitern und Führungskräften erreichen, die immer das "Etwas-mehr" im Blick haben.

Exklusive Einblicke in die Porsche Arbeitswelt erhalten Sie auch auf unseren Karriereprofilen in den sozialen Netzwerken:

"Porschecareers" bei Instagram

"Porsche AG" bei LinkedIn

"Porsche AG" bei Xing

"Jobs & Karriere bei Porsche" bei Facebook

title: Working student in Business Intelligence/ Data analytics (f/m/d)
full_description:

What we care about : You are a registered student with a strong interest in data and analytics. You possess excellent English language skills, and a strong knownlegde of German (for Gümlingen ) or French (for Crissier ) is necessary. You have experience of working with Excel, knowledge of Salesforce, Tableau and SAP would be an advantage, with a solid understanding of data management and CRM systems. #lifeison

title: Senior Data Analyst
full_description:
Job Family Group:
IT&S Group

Job Description:

An exciting new job opportunity has arisen for a Senior Data Analyst to join us in Budapest.

We are a global energy business involved in every aspect of the energy system. We are working towards delivering light, heat and mobility to millions of people, every day. We are one of the very few companies equipped to solve some of the big complex challenges that matter for the future. We have a real contribution to make to the world's ambition of a low carbon future. Join us, and be part of what we can accomplish together. You can participate in our new ambition to become a net zero company by 2050 or sooner, and to help the world get to net zero.

Critical to achieving bp's digital ambitions is the delivery of our high value data and analytics initiatives, and the enablement of the technologies and platforms that will support those objectives. We are developing deep data capability to transform the access, supply, control and quality to our vast and ever-growing reserves of data.

Technology is at the centre of BP's Group Strategy. We use our data and technology expertise, to improve efficiency, increase effectiveness and harness the transformational potential of digital technologies and new business models.

Key Accountabilities:

Be a bridge between business and digital organizations and part of a cross-disciplinary team, working closely with other analysts, product managers, data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, data managers and business partners.
Provide actionable, data-driven business and product insights by combining deep statistical skills, data manipulation capabilities.
Maintain metrics and build dashboards.
Autonomously execute data analysis. Apply existing data & analytics strategies relevant to your immediate scope.
Partner with data engineers to define and build simple data models. Integrate existing tools to automate data ingestion, data manipulation, quality control and data analysis.
Adhere to and advocate for data analytics best practices.
Present results to peers and team members.
Collaborates with stakeholders.
Mentor others.

Essential Experience and Job Requirements:

Degree educated in a quantitative field, preferably statistics, or equivalent.
Hands-on experience (typically approx. 5-7 years) carrying out data analytics, data mining and product analytics in complex, fast-paced environments.
Applied knowledge of data analytics and data pipelining tools and approaches across all data lifecycle stages.
Deep understanding of a few and a high-level understanding of several commonly available statistics approaches.
Advanced SQL knowledge.
Advanced scripting experience in R or python.
Ability to write and maintain moderately complex data pipelines.
Strong business acumen.
Customer-centric and pragmatic attitude. Focus on value delivery and swift execution, while maintaining attention to detail.
Continuous learning and improvement mindset.

Desirable Criteria:

Advanced analytics degree.
Experience with technologies such as Hadoop, Hive, and Spark is a plus.

At bp, we support our people to learn and grow in a diverse and ambitious environment. We believe that our team is strengthened by diversity. We are committed to fostering an inclusive environment in which everyone is respected and treated fairly. There are many aspects of our employees' lives that are meaningful, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits can include flexible working options, excellent retirement benefits, among others!

At bp, we provide the following environment & benefits to you:

Different bonus opportunities based on performance, wide range of cafeteria elements
Life & health insurance, medical care package
Flexible working schedule: home office up to 3 days / week, based on team agreement
Opportunity to build up long term career path and develop your skills with wide range of learning options
Family friendly workplace e.g.: Extended parental leave, Mother-baby room
Employees' wellbeing programs e.g.: Employee Assistance Program, Company Recognition Program
Possibility to join our social communities and networks
Chill-out and collaboration spaces in our beautiful Budapest Agora and Szeged offices e.g.: Play Zones, Office massage, Sport and music equipment
Assets like phone for private usage and company laptop are provided from the first day of employment with other equipment if requested

bp Hungary won the Most Attractive Employer 2023 Award (SSC / BSC sector) third time in a row at PwC's annual employer research. Come and join us!

Travel Requirement:
No travel is expected with this role

Relocation Assistance:
Relocation may be negotiable for this role

Remote Type:
This position is a hybrid of office/remote working

Skills:
Big Data, Big Data, Big Data Hadoop, Big Data Technologies, Business Acumen, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data cleansing and transformation, Data domain knowledge, Data Integration, Data Management, Data Manipulation, Data Mining, Data Sourcing, Data strategy and governance, Data Structures and Algorithms (Inactive), Data visualization and interpretation, Digital Security, Extract, transform and load, Group Problem Solving, Python (Programming Language), Python for Data Analysis, R Scripting {+ 3 more}

Legal Disclaimer:

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, socioeconomic status, neurodiversity/neurocognitive functioning, veteran status or disability status. Individuals with an accessibility need may request an adjustment/accommodation related to bp's recruiting process (e.g., accessing the job application, completing required assessments, participating in telephone screenings or interviews, etc.). If you would like to request an adjustment/accommodation related to the recruitment process, please contact us.

If you are selected for a position and depending upon your role, your employment may be contingent upon adherence to local policy. This may include pre-placement drug screening, medical review of physical fitness for the role, and background checks.

title: Data Center Switchgear and Generator Technician
full_description:
Job Details

Level
Experienced

Job Location
Phoenix - Chandler, AZ

Position Type
Full Time

Education Level
High School

Salary Range
$100,000.00 Salary/year

Travel Percentage
Up to 25%

Job Shift
Day

Job Category
Skilled Labor - Trades

Job Functions

Data Center Switchgear and Generator Technician

Salaried Position with Travel

$100k+ Salary with Annual Performance Bonus Potential

PRIMARY FUNCTION: Work on industry specific backup power generation and all ancillary equipment including switchgear, unit substations, transformers, etc.. This position will work especially close with the Engineering and Sales team.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
Manage all aspects of critical power systems installation, start-up and commissioning.
Available for foreign and domestic travel
Perform diagnostic and repair procedures on all systems including PLCs, AC/DC, and switchgear.
Perform scheduled maintenance on electric power generation equipment including transfer switches and switchgear
Coordinate with partnered service suppliers, specifically engine manufacturers
Coordination with installing electrical contractors.
Oversee correction of issues arising from commissioning
Familiarity with data centers preferred.
Ability to learn data center structured cabling solutions, Category 6 and pre-terminated fiber optic installations.
Ability to learn Data Center network architecture with applicable hardware/electronics.
Ability to update and maintain Excel spreadsheets for cross-connect assignments for all cabling infrastructure, as well as inventory management
Familiarities with protective relay functionality and HRG systems.
Any other tasks as assigned by Manager, Engineer, or Sales.

PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL

RESPONSIBILITIES/CHARACTERISTICS

General skill requisites
Strong selling skills.
Good communications skills.
Excellent customer relations skills.
Good computer and systems knowledge.

Specific skill requisites
A good working knowledge of sales techniques and methodologies.
Solid equipment and parts knowledge.
Sales training in related fields.
Product knowledge including features and benefits knowledge on all items sold.
Good communications skills.
Good, safe work habits.

WORK CONDITIONS

CPS&S promotes a smoke-free and drug-free work environment.

Our Company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

BENEFITS
Competitive Salary
Health Benefits including Medical, Dental, Vision and Life insurance
401(k) with a company match
Paid Time Off
Paid Holidays
Formal Classroom and hands-on training
Company Service Truck

Qualifications

POSITION QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with diesel generators to 2800KW, 13.8kV
Experience with generator paralleling/utility switchgear at 13.8kV level.
A high school degree is required and some college or technical school is a plus.
Solid understanding of basic generator and electrical distribution principles
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to initiate, prioritize, and accomplish multiple tasks independently
Work well with others that come from an eclectic background
Experience and have strong proficiencies with Microsoft Office and Adobe
Self-Motivated with a willingness and flexibility to operate outside of normal business hours, including consistent travel when necessary.

Minimum Work Experience
A minimum of two (2) years of experience in the field of power generators, compressors, and load banks.

Minimum Prerequisites
Must have a valid driver's license and the ability to travel inside and outside of the country. Overnight travel will be common. Long term projects will occur several times a year where the intention would be no longer than 14 days per assignment without home time. Ample vacation time will be provided.

title: Data Specialist
full_description:
At Air Products, our purpose is to bring people together to reimagine what’s possible, collaborate and innovate solutions to the world’s most significant energy and environmental sustainability challenges. Grow with us as we embark on building tomorrow together by being the safest, most diverse and most profitable industrial gas company in the world.

Reimagine What’s Possible

Responsibilities
Work closely with team to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers
Proactively analyze data to answer key questions for stakeholders or yourself, with an eye on what drives business performance, and investigate and communicate which areas need improvement in efficiency and productivity
Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across datasets


Required skills and qualifications
Three or more years of experience in mining data as a data analyst
Extensive experience in the Microsoft Power Platform – MS PowerApps, MS Power Automate (Flow), Power BI and Power virtual agents.
Strong SQL or Excel skills, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools
Excellent Excel Skills
Experience in analysis, design development, testing and implementation of enterprise scale apps
Experience developing new PowerApps model and canvas driven apps as well as enhancing existing apps.
Understanding PowerApps formulas and development methods.
Knowledge of Flow licensing and automating business processes with Microsoft Power Automate/ Flow.
Ability to create business processes and custom connectors for Microsoft Power Automate/ Flow.
Willing to learn leading edge Microsoft enterprise cloud technologies such as Office 365, Microsoft Azure.
Experience of SQL and RDBMS technologies is preferable.
Excellent Excel Skills


Preferred skills and qualifications
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in computer science
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Microsoft Power BI / Microsoft Fabric Certified.


We are the world’s largest hydrogen producer with over 80 years of industrial gas experience. We are hydrogen and industrial gas experts delivering safe, end-to-end solutions, investing in real, clean energy projects at scale, and driving the industry forward to generate a cleaner future.

At Air Products, we work in an environment where we put safety first, diversity is essential, inclusion is our culture, and each person knows they belong and matter. To learn more, visit About Air Products.

title: Operation Manager Data Center
Product Owner - Plant Data
full_description:
Do you want to make a change for the better in the world?

Vestas Technology & Operations > Research & Development (R&D) > Plant Data

Vestas Technology & Operations, a cornerstone of Vestas, is committed to innovation, product development, and continuous improvement. We seek to develop market products and technologies that deliver down the cost of energy, delivering maximum value to both our customers and Vestas.

As a part of Vestas Technology & Operations, the Modelling & Analytics, Plant Data team is responsible for the creation and management of products and services related to Vestas Plant Data Offerings. Our accomplished and diverse team of Data Engineers is focused on designing products that facilitate data collection, processing and storage from thousands of power plants across the world. The team also develops data storage and conducts data analytics on a hybrid data platform setup that supports multiple data applications for our customers.

Our overarching goal is to reduce the cost of energy by harnessing the extensive data collected and stored by Vestas from power plants worldwide. Join us in this mission to make a meaningful impact on the future of renewable energy.

Responsibilities
Ensure creation and prioritize user stories for the team, maximizing the value delivered by the team and ensuring that the backlog is aligned with the stakeholder's needs.
Aligning with business stakeholders, e. g., the product owner (PO) needs to have customer-centric mindset to guide the team to deliver solutions that are desirable, viable, feasible and sustainable.
Contributing to the Vision and roadmap of their products in collaboration with the SAFe Product Manager (SPM), business and the team.
Managing and Prioritizing the team Backlog, e.g., with the inputs of the stakeholders the PO is responsible for creating backlog of the team.
Ensure continuous feedback from the business to the team to incorporate in the team's backlog for future prioritization.
Ensure the team delivers Value to the business.
Prioritize the team backlog of stories (including enabler stories)
Ensure that user stories are in line with feature acceptance criteria, the features that the team have agreed to work on, and the vision.
Agrees on the committed features/feature backlog with the team for the PI
Participate & facilitate PI planning and aligns the agreements made with the SPM prior and during PI planning.
Participates in sprint review and retrospective to bring the feedback from the stakeholder.


Qualifications
Bachelor's or master's Degree: A bachelor's or master's degree (Computer Science, Data Science, Business Administration, Information Technology etc.)
Experience: At least 5 years of experience as a product owner or similar role within the data analytics field is typically required.
Communication Skills: Advanced English communication & comprehension skills, both written and verbal, are essential.


Would be an added advantage to have any of the below:
Certification in Product Management, such as Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO), Certified ScrumMaster (CSM), SAFe (Scaled Agile Framework) certifications
Familiarity with data analytics technologies like SQL server, Snowflake, Databricks etc.
Domain Knowledge in renewable energy space.


Competencies
At least 5 years of experience as a Product Owner or in a similar role in the data analytics field. Proven history of effectively implementing and delivering data analytics products.
Good customer-centric mindset to guide the team in delivering solutions that are desirable, viable, feasible, and sustainable.
Ability to contribute to the vision and roadmap of data analytics products in collaboration with the Module Product Manager, business stakeholders, and the team.
Proficiency in managing and prioritizing the team's backlog based on stakeholder input.
Ensuring alignment of the backlog with business needs and priorities.
Skill in gathering continuous feedback from the business stakeholders and incorporating it into the team's backlog for future prioritization.
Demonstrated ability to ensure the team delivers value to the business.
Experience working with Agile methodologies, including participation in PI (Program Increment) planning, sprint reviews, and retrospectives.
Advanced English communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively communicate with team members, stakeholders, and leadership.
A solid understanding of data analytics concepts and technologies, as well as the ability to collaborate effectively with technical teams, such as data engineers and data analysts.
Great leadership and collaboration skills to work closely with cross-functional teams, including data engineers, data scientists, and business stakeholders.
Proficiency in problem-solving and decision-making to address challenges and make strategic product-related decisions.
Ability to adapt to rapidly changing requirements and priorities in a collaborative data analytics environment.


What We Offer
You will be part of an international organization with opportunities to grow and develop in the job professionally and personally.
A position that lets shape products in key data areas in Vestas's landscape.
Opportunity to work with and solve challenges related to processing, managing and delivering value from true large scale industrial IOT data.


Additional information

We look forward to receiving your application as soon as possible, as we will be reviewing applications on a rolling basis. To apply for this opportunity please submit your resume in English.

BEWARE - RECRUITMENT FRAUD
It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails from people pretending to work for Vestas. Read more via this link, https://www.vestas.com/en/careers/our-recruitment-process

DEIB Statement
At Vestas, we recognize the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in driving innovation and success. We strongly encourage individuals from all backgrounds to apply, particularly those who may hesitate due to their identity or feel they do not meet every criterion. As our CEO states, "Expertise and talent come in many forms, and a diverse workforce enhances our ability to think differently and solve the complex challenges of our industry". Your unique perspective is what will help us powering the solution for a sustainable, green energy future.

About Vestas
Vestas is the energy industry's global partner on sustainable energy solutions. We are specialised in designing, manufacturing, installing, and servicing wind turbines, both onshore and offshore.
Across the globe, we have installed more wind power than anyone else. We consider ourselves pioneers within the industry, as we continuously aim to design new solutions and technologies to create a more sustainable future for all of us. With more than 173 GW of wind power installed worldwide and 40+ years of experience in wind energy, we have an unmatched track record demonstrating our expertise within the field.
With 29,000 employees globally, we are a diverse team united by a common goal: to power the solution - today, tomorrow, and far into the future.
Vestas promotes a diverse workforce which embraces all social identities and is free of any discrimination. We commit to create and sustain an environment that acknowledges and harvests different experiences, skills, and perspectives. We also aim to give everyone equal access to opportunity.
To learn more about our company and life at Vestas, we invite you to visit our website at www.vestas.com and follow us on our social media channels. We also encourage you to join our Talent Universe to receive notifications on new and relevant postings.

title: URGENT: Performance & Data Analysis Engineer - TotalEnergies Renewables Ibérica
full_description:
Context & Environment

• Spain is a priority country for the "energy transition" strategy of TotalEnergies. Its portfolio of operating solar projects, considering the ones

already under construction, is expected to amount at 300 MWp in 2024 (including 10 MWp already operational) and 400 MWp in 2025;

including wind and solar projects under development, the operating portfolio is expected to be 1200 MW in 2026 and 3000 MW in 2027.

• At the moment, TotalEnergies has no centralized infrastructure in place yet in Spain for real-time asset monitoring, and no structured protocols or tools

for operational data collection and analysis. The Performance and Data Analysis Engineer is expected to be a main contributor to define

strategies and procedures for compilation and treatment of signals and data, to be applied in the future real-time operation command and

control centre when implemented (expected 2025-26).

Activities

Reporting to the Operation and Maintenance manager, the Performance & Data Analysis Engineer will be a member of the PV technical asset

management ("TAM") team of TotalEnergies Renewables Ibérica ("TERIb"). He/she will be the reference person for all topics related to asset

data collection, treatment and analysis; operating asset performance assessment and reporting; definition, evaluation, treatment and follow-up

of asset signals and alarms associated with performances.

Key responsibilities:

• Monitor, calculate, and report key performance indicators (KPIs) for solar photovoltaic (PV) assets, (future) wind assets, (future) Battery

Energy Storage Systems.

• Calculate and analyze performance and losses in operating assets using real meteorological data.

• Perform simulations to validate and compare real-world performance against modeled expectations.

• Create reports on performance, losses, and variance analysis.

• Conduct comprehensive data-driven performance analysis to identify opportunities for optimizing renewable energy asset operations.

• Develop and implement procedures and protocols for early detection and resolution of technical issues.

• Design and implement automated operational performance reports as well as alarm generation and treatment procedures.

• Develop and refine VBA, Python, or similar scripts to streamline data preparation, analysis, and reporting.

• Interact and collaborate with relevant departments of TotalEnergies in France and other geographies, contributing and implementing

international homogenization strategies for asset performance assessment and analysis, and for internal reporting.

Candidate Profile

• Bachelor's degree in Engineering or a related field.

• Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience (asset performance monitoring and data analysis) in the PV industry.

• Proficiency in PVSyst and deep understanding of performance & losses in utility-scale PV systems.

• Competence in programming languages and tools for data analysis (e.g. Python, Power BI...) is highly desirable.

• English min. C1; Spanish min. C1. Both written and spoken.

• Strong analytical skills with a proactive approach to problem-solving.

• Ability to work in a dynamic environment with a flexible, innovative, and entrepreneurial mindset.

Additional Information

TotalEnergies values diversity, promotes individual growth and offers equal opportunity careers.

Apply

Facebook
Email
X
LinkedIn

title: Data Management Development Lead
full_description:
We are looking for a Data Management Development Lead for one of our clients with the following details:
Start Date: JAN-2025
End Date: DEC-2026
Location: DOHA, Qatar Office
Work Status: Residential, Single
Qualifications & Experience Required
Confirmed Lead Document Controller with 15 years of professional experience in Industrial Projects Management organizations and with an excellent working knowledge of document & data control. With an important experience on new fields operator company transition phases, Legacy documentation upgrade and management, and technical documentation and fields digitalization.
Co-ordinated approach to resolving problems in a timely manner.
Strong understanding of Planning, Project controls in large scale EPCIC projects or portfolio of brownfield projects.
Proficiency in P6, Power BI, SAP.
Activity:
HSE:
Support safety culture through participation in Company safety initiatives such as Incident Free.
Involve improving the quality of Al Shaheen documentation to reduce HSE risks arising from poor documentation
Digital Project interfaces:
Manage all activities to structure, recover, correct, upgrade, and maintain the metadata of Al Shaheen documentation to ensure the integrity of the structured data contained in the technical documentation,
In charge to write the scope of work, define the planning, run the project, organize weekly meetings, set up follow-up progress, validate the invoices, import deliverables within MANASA/iView and manage any other tasks related to the activities and contracts.
Manage the creation of the Import file (MIM) or Update file (MUM) and associated data as per MANASA requirements to import/update all documents and related metadata into MANASA Operation (As-Built cabinet).
Ensure that all Al Shaheen technical documents part of MANASA Operation (As-Built cabinet) are uploaded in iPDF standard format.
Develop a strategy and related tools to ensure the quality of all documents and metadata produced and delivered per Contractors.
Support the development of use cases of the Digital Project by ensuring compatibility with TAG centric Company vision, standards & rules and interfaces with iView and iTools solution.
Create interfaces between technical documents and multiple Company application (SAP, 3D Model, etc…)
Support the development of 3D Model development to ensure that deliverables extracted from 3D Model are produced in line with Digital project requirements
Build interfaces between Company document management system and specific use cases of the Digital Project
Support the Data Governance Project.
Involve in all interfaces with E&C and MP DCC teams on several topics (Doc management, doc and Tag numbering, Tools development, MANASA interfaces, etc…).
Involve in all interfaces with 3D Model Team to develop plugins and interfaces and coordinate all activities related to TAGs such as NNG rules and interfaces.
Company Focal point for INCITIUS Software as OEM since 2017 and therefore involved in any activities done by Company with this company.
Involve setting up all requirements and workflow of MP Green fields Projects Final documentation to ensure the quality level of structured metadata part of the Final documentation to be synchronized within iView.
Support any Company entities or initiatives to improve the quality of Al Shaheen documentation metadata or to optimize access time to Al Shaheen documentation to improve the productivity and safety on Al Shaheen field.
Ensure dashboard are developed with good quality data.
Support planning, document control and cost control for regular quality checks of data to support automation.
Oversee all control tools and system, ensuring accurate reporting and reconciliation.
Support all E&C departments with implementation of any new tools or dashboard development upon request.
Foster collaboration between planning, cost control, project management and stakeholders with proper reporting tools.
Support all the department with data standardization and quality checks.
Support all digital transformation initiative across all department in E&C.
iView manager:
Company users to access to Al Shaheen documentation (iView) - 310 000 documents (last revision only)
Provide support to all Company users (onshore and Offshore).
Maintain and develop iView in line with the digital vision of Company.
Develop interfaces between iView and other Company application.
iView focal point for the digital project.
Manage and maintain synchronization process between MANASA Operation and iView (with IS)
Create standalone advanced viewers for MP / E&C / CPD / Company Contractors / Qatar Energy / any external companies with selected documents and licenses limited to project time.
Coordinate with IS Department iView contract, licenses, development, cost and disaster project.
iTools solution:
Involved in the development of tools and plugins embedding Company rules to be used by Company Contractors to produce all deliverables.
Involved in the development of tools and plugins to produce deliverable documents in iPDF format with all "intelligent" functionalities used within iView.
Coordinate any new development to identify any potential impacts on existing tools and DPG #Use Cases.
Tags and documents numbering rules & standards:
Write and maintain updated related parts of Company standard and rules in coordination with Company Departments (MP, E&C, DPG, CPD, etc…)
Analyze validation of new rules to be added to Company standards and all potential impacts on existing tools and DPG #Use Cases
Coordinate with DPG to ensure that Company rules are applied on #Use Cases and/or find solution for Company application not fully complying with numbering rules (SAP, 3D Model, Credo, etc…)
If interested, kindly apply!

Ensure dashboard are developed with good quality data.
Support planning, document control and cost control for regular quality checks of data to support automation.
Oversee all control tools and system, ensuring accurate reporting and reconciliation.
Support all E&C departments with implementation of any new tools or dashboard development upon request.
Foster collaboration between planning, cost control, project management and stakeholders with proper reporting tools.
Support all the department with data standardization and quality checks.
Support all digital transformation initiative across all department in E&C.
iView manager:

Provide support to all Company users (onshore and Offshore).
Maintain and develop iView in line with the digital vision of Company.

iView focal point for the digital project.
Manage and maintain synchronization process between MANASA Operation and iView (with IS)
Create standalone advanced viewers for MP / E&C / CPD / Company Contractors / Qatar Energy / any external companies with selected documents and licenses limited to project time.

title: Solutions Architect - Oil and Gas Drilling Data Systems
full_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

About Us: NOV is a leading provider of innovative technology solutions for the oil and gas industry. We specialize in delivering high-quality software solutions that help our clients optimize their drilling operations, enhance productivity, and drive business growth. We are looking for a skilled Solutions Architect to join our dynamic team and support both internal and customer-facing initiatives.

Job Summary: As a Solutions Architect, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and managing data integration solutions between various oil and gas drilling data software systems. You will work closely with internal teams and external clients to understand their requirements, provide technical support, and ensure seamless integration of data connections. Your expertise in data architecture and software integration will be critical in helping our clients achieve operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities:

Technical Leadership:


Lead the design and implementation of data integration solutions for oil and gas drilling data systems.
Provide architectural guidance and technical leadership to internal teams and clients.
Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to understand their business needs and technical requirements.
Translate business requirements into technical specifications and integration plans.
Develop comprehensive integration strategies and architectures that ensure seamless data flow between disparate systems.
Design data models, schemas, and mappings to support data integration efforts.
Oversee the implementation of data integration solutions, ensuring they meet quality, performance, and security standards.
Provide ongoing support and troubleshooting for integration issues, both internally and for clients.
Work closely with software development teams to ensure alignment between integration solutions and overall software architecture.
Collaborate with clients' IT teams to facilitate smooth integration processes.
Create detailed documentation for integration solutions, including architecture diagrams, data flow diagrams, and technical specifications.
Maintain up-to-date documentation for ongoing support and future enhancements.
Stay current with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies related to data integration and the oil and gas sector.
Propose and implement improvements to existing integration processes and solutions.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or similar role, with a focus on data integration and software systems.
Strong understanding of oil and gas drilling data systems and industry-specific software.
Proficiency in data modeling, ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, and data integration tools.
Experience with APIs, web services, and middleware technologies.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex integration issues.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Relevant certifications (e.g., TOGAF, AWS Certified Solutions Architect) are a plus.




Why Join Us:

Opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology solutions in the oil and gas industry.
Collaborative and innovative work environment.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Professional development and career growth opportunities.


ABOUT US

Every day, the oil and gas industry's best minds put more than 150 years of experience to work to help our customers achieve lasting success.

We Power the Industry that Powers the World

Throughout every region in the world and across every area of drilling and production, our family of companies has provided the technical expertise, advanced equipment, and operational support necessary for success-now and in the future.

Global Family

We are a global family of thousands of individuals, working as one team to create a lasting impact for ourselves, our customers, and the communities where we live and work.

Purposeful Innovation

Through purposeful business innovation, product creation, and service delivery, we are driven to power the industry that powers the world better.

Service Above All

This drives us to anticipate our customers' needs and work with them to deliver the finest products and services on time and on budget.

title: Data Privacy Analyst (m/w/d)
full_description:
ACT NOW! ENGIE arbeitet in Deutschland an der Entwicklung eines diversifizierten Energiemixes, bei dem der Anteil der erneuerbaren Energien deutlich steigen soll. Mehr als 5.900 Mitarbeiter:innen an 50 Standorten in Deutschland packen beim Thema Klimaneutralität richtig an.

Wie wir das machen? Zum Beispiel planen wir zukunftsorientierte Lösungen rund um Wind-, Solar-, Wasser- und Speicheraktivitäten, entwickeln diese und setzen sie um. Oder wir sorgen dafür, dass in den Produktionen unserer Kund:innen CO2 eingespart wird. Oder wir unterstützen beim technischen Gebäudemanagement im Bereich Heizung, Sanitär, Klima und Kältetechnik. Oder, oder, oder. Sie sehen: Wir nehmen ACT NOW! wörtlich.

Wir sind bereit - und arbeiten heute schon an der Zukunft von morgen. Sind Sie es auch?

Werden Sie Teil unseres Erfolges und verstärken Sie unser #TeamZeroCarbon als

Data Privacy Analyst (m/w/d)

Standort: Berlin

Kennziffer: 33597

ACT NOW! - das sind Ihre Aufgaben:

Verwaltung und Weiterentwicklung des Datenschutzmanagementsystems, einschließlich Prüfung und Verhandlung von Auftragsverarbeitungsverträgen und Pflege der Datenschutzdokumentation
Unterstützung bei der Einführung von IT-Applikationen und Überwachung der Einhaltung von Datenschutzvorgaben in Zusammenarbeit mit dem Datenschutzmanagement (DPM)
Schulung und Coaching von Mitarbeitenden sowie Unterstützung bei der Pflege des Verfahrensverzeichnisses
Bewertung von Datenschutzanforderungen in Geschäftsprozessen und Bearbeitung von Anfragen betroffener Personen
Mitwirkung bei der Erstellung von Kommunikations- und Schulungsmaterial


Ihr Profil - das sollten Sie mitbringen:

Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Jura oder IT
Erste Erfahrungen in ähnlichen Funktionen aus dem Data-Privacy-Bereich
Idealerweise gute Kenntnisse der DSGVO und der deutschen Umsetzungsgesetze
Organisierte, proaktive und lösungsorientierte Arbeitsweise
Sehr gute Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse


Wir leben Vielfalt

ENGIE Deutschland hat viele Gesichter. Über 5.900 Menschen an über 50 Standorten handeln gemeinsam für eine nachhaltige und klimaneutrale Zukunft. Mitarbeiter:innen unterschiedlicher Herkunft und Prägung bereichern unsere Teams und unser Unternehmen. Das sorgt für mehr Kreativität und Innovationsstärke.

Wir begrüßen ausdrücklich Bewerbungen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

#ActwithENGIE Sie möchten Ihre Energie bei uns einbringen, aber erfüllen die Anforderungen der Stelle nicht zu 100%? Gar kein Problem - Zusammen laufen wir über die Ziellinie.

Unsere Benefits:

AKKU AUFLADEN: Wer durch powert muss auch frische Energie tanken! Deswegen sind uns Momente der gemeinsamen Entspannung besonders wichtig - zum Beispiel beim Sommerfest oder beim Ski-Ausflug
ZUKUNFT? ABGESICHERT!: Wir blicken auch bei Ihrer Lebensplanung voraus. Mit Zuschüssen für die betriebliche Altersvorsorge und speziellen Angeboten für Berufsunfähigkeitsversicherungen.
ELEKTRISIERENDE EXTRAS: Ob E-Bikes, elektronische Hardware oder Rabatte - beim Durchstöbern der ENGIE Plattform für unsere Mitarbeiter:innen gibt es jede Menge Produkte, Dienstleistungen und Preisvorteile namhafter (Online-) Shops zu entdecken.
ENERGIE OPTIMAL ENTFALTEN: Bei ENGIE sind wir immer offen für fachliche und funktionsbezogene Weiterentwicklungen, Trainings, Workshops, Weiterbildungen - machen Sie das, was Sie und uns weiterbringt.
ON UND OFF NACH BEDARF: Schalten Sie ab, wenn es passt. Mit unserer flexiblen Projektarbeit haben Sie große Freiräume zur Gestaltung Ihrer Arbeitszeiten.


ACT NOW!

Werden auch Sie Teil des #TeamZeroCarbon mit exzellenten Karriereperspektiven und hoher Anerkennung. Gestalten Sie zusammen mit uns den Übergang zur Klimaneutralität. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung.

title: Information Systems, IT, Cyber Engineer & Data Science - Recent Grad/Full Time (US Person Required)
full_description:
Join a team recognized for leadership, innovation and diversity

The future is what you make it.

When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers, and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn't just about developing cool things. That's why our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.

Are you ready to help us make the future?

ABOUT THE ROLE:
Honeywell is hiring Recent Graduates from bachelor's and master's degree programs to join our technology teams. Are you ready to get inspired as you take on impactful projects, build business skills and interact with management? You'll help solve real-world obstacles. Work with managers in your field on meaningful projects that directly relate to key Honeywell business goals.

Location: This position is available in multiple locations across the United States.

Pay Range:
The annual base salary range for this position is $75,000.00/yr - $105,500.00/yr. Please note that this salary information serves as a general guideline. Honeywell considers various factors when extending an offer, including but not limited to the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate's work experience, education and training, key skills, as well as market and business considerations.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Must be pursuing a bachelor's degree (or higher) from an accredited college or university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, Data Science, Cyber Security, MIS or similar field
Must graduate from an accredited college or university between December 2024 and May 2025 and be available to begin full-time work between January 2025 - July 2025
Must have obtained degree within 12 months of start date
Due to compliance with U.S. export control laws and regulations, candidate must be a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident, or have asylum or refugee status in the U.S.

WE VALUE:
Passion for using, developing, evaluating and learning about new technologies
Foundational business acumen and desire to improve your business knowledge
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
Ability to work with multi-functional teams to meet expectations of internal and external customers

BENEFITS:

In addition to a competitive salary, leading-edge work, and developing solutions side-by-side with dedicated experts in their fields, Honeywell employees are eligible for a comprehensive benefits package. This package includes employer subsidized Medical, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance; Short-Term and Long-Term Disability; 401(k) match, Flexible Spending Accounts, Health Savings Accounts, EAP, and Educational Assistance; Parental Leave, Paid Time Off (for vacation, personal business, sick time, and parental leave), and 12 Paid Holidays. For more information visit: Benefits at Honeywell

The application period for the job is estimated to be 40 days from the job posting date; however, this may be shortened or extended depending on business needs and the availability of qualified candidates.

HoneywellURNAM

Location: United States
Exempt

title: Data Engineer I.Colombia . IT&S&S Projects:46 Standard Hours
full_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Wood Colombia busca para su equipo de trabajo ingeniero de Datos / Líder de Integración, Profesional con más de cinco años o Maestría con más de tres años de experiencia en gestión de datos, con enfoque particular en mantenimiento, minería, modelado y almacenamiento de datos. Se requiere experiencia con entregables de ingeniería.

• Habilidades expertas en diseño, codificación, pruebas, depuración y/o administración de sistemas y soporte al usuario.

• Competencia en la actualización de software existente y desarrollo de nuevos sistemas para cumplir con los requisitos empresariales.

• Competencia en herramientas de informes y análisis como Power BI, SSRS, etc.

• Competencia con servicios de integración como NiFi, SSIS, etc.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Capacidad para recomendar soluciones técnicas que mejoren el diseño, mantenimiento o funcionalidad del sistema e identificar/resolver problemas relacionados con el código de la aplicación.

• Experto en ejecutar procesos adecuados para extraer periódicamente datos de diversas fuentes y transferirlos eficientemente al Almacén de Datos de Ingeniería del Proyecto (EDW).

• Capacidad demostrada para resolver problemas relacionados con datos y promover la mejora de procesos.

• Capacidad demostrada para apoyar el proyecto en el diseño, configuración, implementación y soporte de interfaces, asegurando la integridad y gestión de los datos

QUALIFICATIONS

Profesional en ingeniería de sistemas, Ciencias de la Computación, ingenierías en campos relacionados, o combinación equivalente de educación y experiencia laboral. • Competencia en todas las fases del ciclo de vida del desarrollo de software (SDLC), desde requisitos, desarrollo, pruebas, construcción hasta despliegue. • Competencia en metodologías de desarrollo de software, técnicas de programación .Net o Java, experiencia en bases de datos relacionales (SQL Server, Oracle, etc.), arquitectura orientada a servicios y SOAP/XML, SSRS, herramientas ETL y diseño de software orientado a objetos. • Habilidades de comunicación oral y escrita con buen vocabulario, buena gramática y capacidad para redactar comunicaciones escritas rutinarias de manera independiente en inglés. • Capacidad de trabajar en equipo y disposición para asumir nuevos retos.

Wood is a global leader in consulting and engineering, helping to unlock solutions to critical challenges in energy and materials markets. We provide consulting, projects and operations solutions in 60 countries, employing around 35,000 people. www.woodplc.com

title: Stage - Data analyst - Pricing & Développement Réseau Stations - AS 24
full_description:
Context & Environment

Rejoignez une entreprise conviviale, internationale (25 nationalités différentes) et à taille humaine, partenaire de la transition énergétique des professionnels de la route.

Intégrer AS 24, c'est participer à une aventure locale démarrée il y a 35 ans et qui place l'innovation et l'orientation client au cœur de ses priorités.

D'abord reconnue pour son réseau de stations 100% automatisées et leader du marché Français, AS 24 est maintenant présente dans 27 pays Européens avec plus de 1500 stations, et propose une offre complète et connectée aux besoins des transporteurs : télépéages, géolocalisation, stations nouvelles énergies, services digitaux.

Dans le cadre de son développement, AS 24 (6 Md€ de CA en 2023) est accompagnée par TotalEnergies, dont elle est filiale, ce qui lui donne l'élan nécessaire à ses ambitions, au service de ses 30 000 clients et de ses 420 collaborateurs.

Activities

Quelle sera votre contribution au sein d'AS 24 ?

Vous effectuerez votre stage au siège d'AS 24 à Saint-Herblain au sein de l'équipe Développement Réseau d'AS24 à partir de janvier 2025 pour une durée de 6 mois. Vous travaillerez en transverse avec les différentes équipes d'AS 24. Vous ferez pleinement partie d'une équipe dynamique, engagée et solidaire au cœur des enjeux stratégiques de l'entreprise. Rattaché(e) au Chef de Projet Développement Réseau Supply Pricing, les missions portent sur :

Outil de référentiel sites :
Prendre part au lancement de la nouvelle version de l'outil de référentiel des sites AS 24,
Réaliser la recette des nouvelles fonctionnalités,
Être force de proposition sur l'implémentation des évolutions pour une meilleure expérience utilisateur,
Faire évoluer les référentiels d'informations et modes opératoires pour accompagner les filiales dans la prise en main,
Analyser les retours utilisateurs pour donner suite à la mise en production, et être force de proposition pour faire évoluer l'outil,
Participer aux projets connexes permettant notamment la mise à disposition d'information aux clients

Outils de reporting et pricing :
Participer à l'élaboration et l'évolution des outils de reporting et de pricing du département notamment via l'utilisation de PowerBI,
Réaliser et mettre à jour les modes opératoires pour accompagner les filiales dans leur utilisation quotidienne des outils,
Analyser les retours utilisateurs et être force de proposition pour faire évoluer les outils,
Mettre à jour et publier des reportings mensuels sur PowerBI,
Travailler en collaboration avec la DSI pour garantir la bonne mise à disposition des données et leur fiabilité.

Etude d'analyse du réseau AS 24 :
Accompagnement des filiales dans leurs études d'analyse du réseau (saturation, ...)
Réalisation des REX des derniers projets de construction

Préparation et mise à jour de supports stratégiques :
Assister les chefs de projet dans la préparation de réunions/présentations stratégiques,
Réaliser la mise à jour des supports de prospection foncière pour le développement du Réseau France en coordination avec le développement de nouvelles énergies,
Mettre à jour le toolkit du développement réseau, document de référence à destination des filiales.

Candidate Profile

Vous êtes étudiant de l'enseignement supérieur (Bac +4/5) - Ecole de Commerce, Université, Ecole d'Ingénieurs,

Vous avez de l'intérêt pour le Business Development, et/ou pour le domaine de l'énergie,

Vous avez de l'appétence pour les chiffres, le traitement et la manipulation de données complexes et une bonne capacité d'analyse,

Vous avez une bonne maîtrise du Pack Office, notamment Power BI,

Vous avez une bonne maîtrise de l'anglais (contacts fréquents et animations d'ateliers avec nos filiales) et de bonnes capacités relationnelles.

Vous êtes rigoureux, autonome et proactif !

Additional Information

TotalEnergies values diversity, promotes individual growth and offers equal opportunity careers.
